title: Prof. Noam Chomsky on Economy & Politics of Pakistan, India & South Asia I PIDE Debate
description:
Prof. Noam Chomsky warns about South Asian future, at PIDE Debate with Dr. Abdul Jalil (Professor of Economics at PIDE)

For Pakistan, to start a new journey on the right track, first of all, it has get itself free from the clutches of colonial legacy and institutions, said Professor Noam Chomsky - an American linguist, philosopher, cognitive scientist, social critic, political activist and also known as "the father of modern linguistics". He authored more than 150 books on range of topics. Chomsky was in conversation with Dr. Abdul Jalil, PIDE
Dr. Jalil asked about the academic view of the reasons behind Pakistanâ€™s sad state of affairs; on economic front in particular. Moreover, if Pakistan has to reset, with the current circumstance, then where is the starting point?
